intro: Ranunculus trichocarpus var. haussknechtii, commonly known as the Hausknecht's buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It features delicate, palmately divided leaves and yellow flowers with five petals, typical of the Ranunculaceae family. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and it is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
